author: holgerd77
content:
Hi everyone, I wanted to do some local `devnet-6` testing combining EthereumJS with lighthouse (took https://github.com/sigp/lighthouse/releases/tag/v7.0.0-beta.5) without usage of wrapper-tooling like Docker/Ansible/Kubernetes or the like.

Basically running this command:

```shell
lighthouse beacon_node \
  --datadir=./datadir \
  --testnet-dir=./network-config \
  --allow-insecure-genesis-sync \
  --execution-endpoint=http://localhost:8551 \
  --execution-jwt=/Users/USERNAME/Library/Ethereum/ethereumjs/jwtsecret \
  --boot-nodes=enr:-Iq4QGEKWSmZX2L5BxnnLyV1lqmgb-GxWXj-DUe50ILbXzMxTfL4YVHLOqRDrlQ9XmN-JUEt_qOqSjy023N4BWTCyi6GAZTMP2G2gmlkgnY0gmlwhLympd-Jc2VjcDI1NmsxoQJJ3h8aUO3GJHv-bdvHtsQZ2OEisutelYfGjXO4lSg8BYN1ZHCCIzI,MORE_NODES
```

with `network-config` being a reference to https://github.com/ethpandaops/pectra-devnets/tree/master/network-configs/devnet-6/metadata and bootnodes taken as a comma-separated list from https://github.com/ethpandaops/pectra-devnets/blob/master/network-configs/devnet-6/metadata/bootstrap_nodes.txt, EL <-> CL connection gets established.

I am now just **not getting peers** on the lighthouse side. Anyone ad-hoc spotting what I am doing wrong?

author: barnabasbusa
content: any reason you aren't using kurtosis?

author: holgerd77
content: I prefer to have direct control over everything, not totally against though. So where would I start then?

author: holgerd77
content: There isn't any Kurtosis reference here https://github.com/ethpandaops/pectra-devnets if I am not mistaken.

author: barnabasbusa
content:
```yaml
participants:
  - el_type: ethereumjs
    el_image: ethpandaops/ethereumjs:master
    cl_type: lighthouse
    cl_image: sigp/lighthouse:v7.0.0-beta.5
network_params:
  network: pectra-devnet-6
checkpoint_sync_enabled: true
checkpoint_sync_url: https://checkpoint-sync.pectra-devnet-6.ethpandaops.io
```

author: barnabasbusa
content: you can just specify that you want to use pectra-devnet-6 as your network and it should get all the info from our repos

author: barnabasbusa
content: forgot that you need to enable checkpoint sync too. I'll probably set that as default for devnets

author: holgerd77
content:
Can you give me a dummy-first-round-pointer? So I would roughly...
1. Install/setup/understand Kurtosis from https://github.com/kurtosis-tech/kurtosis
2. Clone https://github.com/ethpandaops/pectra-devnets (do I need to setup anything from there as well?) and then...
3. Run some Kurtosis command against some file from the `pectra-devnets` repo?

Is this roughly correct?

author: barnabasbusa
content:
Step1: install kt: https://docs.kurtosis.com/install
Step2: Save the file under file.yaml
Step3: `kurtosis run github.com/ethpandaops/ethereum-package --args-file file.yaml --image-download always`

author: barnabasbusa
content: no need to clone anything, just have that above mentioned yaml file saved locally so you can reference it

author: barnabasbusa
content: and you can also use your local branch if you build a docker image locally

author: holgerd77
content: Ah, so that's self-contained? No extract from some `pectra-devnets` file?

author: barnabasbusa
content: it fetches all the network params and bootnode info automagically

content: Ok, I guess I might be able to do that! Thanks a lot! üôè üôÇ
